    ];
    
    $headers = [
        'Authorization: key=AAAAzf7YaO8:APA91bHbgKv_5f1FdC6sp_JNmTA3yAeC0CUEcgiXeVFdXvyZHE9pCV9WLG_bL0W_Ml4_SwwNEKkMoZPJnrR4lbSHIyMFiTGOuy5XM1h_im_7DhrU7mB9briXQwuxIuzq13yG0JhLTGTF',
        
        'Content-Type: application/json',
    
    ];
    
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, 'https://fcm.googleapis.com/fcm/send');
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 0);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, FALSE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($fields));
    
    $result = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($result === FALSE) {
        response(400, "Something went wrong");
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    $explode = explode(",", $result);
    $new_exp = explode(":", $explode[1]);
    if ($new_exp[1] == 0) {
        response(400, "Incorrect Token");
    } else {
        response(200, "Notification sent successfully.");
    }
} else {
    response(400, "FCM token required");
}

function response ($status, $status_message) {
    header("HTTP/1.1 " . $status);
    
    $response['status'] = $status;
    $response['message'] = $status_message;
    
    $json_response = json_encode($response);
    echo $json_response;
}

Here's how to call the new API:

Same end points you're using for the attachments and notes, i.e.:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live, using the same API key you're using already.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/reassign

The body of the POST is this form of JSON:
{
"XNAddress": "GLOBAL.SARASOTA.FL.TEST",
"XM8UserId": "CH"
}

As with the Notes endpoint the call is going to be processed and forwarded over to Xact immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body like this: {"error": "no XNAddress"}.

You'll note there's an XM8UserId attribute in the JSON. That's actually optional, i.e. you can just send the XNAddress and leave out the XM8UserId attribute altogether. BUT, I've discussed this with Elizabeth at Xact and she says "You donâ€™t necessarily have to send over the XM8 userid, but it will default to the main user on the account, and instead of going directly to the assigned user the assignment will show up under â€˜all projectsâ€™, if that makes sense." Which doesn't actually make a whole lot of sense to me! But I think we just need to try it in the live environment and see how it comes through in Xact when you just send, say, an XNAddress of GLOBAL.EV.JUSTIN.SARASOTA.FL.2 without a XM8UserId.

\App\Http\Controllers\PdfController holds the current start point for making a pdf to view, you can use this to test things.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\PDFBuilder holds all the stuff for actually creating a PDF.

\App\Console\Commands\CreateAssignmentPdfs::handle contains a block of PDFs to be generated and saved, simply add the invoice one to that list and you'll be good.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\CreatePDF::getPDF contains the actual code to generate the PDF

Hey @Kris Anolfo, I can't find details of the billing calc that is gonna need to be done in TV using the stories, pitch & field inspector / drone resource information.
Wondering if we're gonna need the stories / pitch to be numeric? E.g. if the billing calc is gonna include anything like stories >= where it relies on doing numeric operation?
In the OnDemand MySQL database I'm seeing that assignment_property_data has the stories/pre_dominate_pitch/steepest_pitch columns as varchar(255) data types, although where the stories has so far been populated so far it's actually numeric (there are no examples of the pitch columns being populated so far).
Any thoughts on how we'll need the data to be structured in TV? E.g. are simple text values going to be adequate?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596109458935,"updated":1596109694970,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-170","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey again @Kris Anolfo, on a similar note, what data do we need stored on each claim in TV for the field inspector / drone resource? For example, for each claim in TV we could just have:

  • Field Inspector ID
  • Field Inspector Name
  • Drone Resource ID
  • Drone Resource Name
    Each of those IDs could maybe just be the id from the users table in the OnDemand MySQL database (since that's where this info is gonna be coming from to start with).
    Or is there a bunch of other info that would be needed for billing? E.g. an actual Employee ID and/or each person's email address or other stuff?
    If there are many additional data points needed for each person then we'll need to decide whether we handle that by either:
  1. adding those data points into the OnDemand database so it can send that info over to TV for each claim; or
  2. setting up a central, linked table in TV that stores this info for each person but with a sync process or link identifier to hook into the OnDemand database, e.g. so TV gets a user ID from OnDemand and can link that to its person table to infer the other data points.
    Option 1 seems like it might be easiest/best but it would rely it being possible to maintain that data in the OnDemand app (it limits our reliance on maintaining key data in TV though?).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596112161020,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-171","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Another consideration on this is that for each carrier in OnDemand it's ideally going to need to tell any new API I set-up what the relevant TrackVia "View ID" is when it's sending over any claim data. The TV API will need that because these claims are stored in separate client apps/tables in TrackVia, e.g. there's a different app and different table/view for SFI versus other clients, etc. So, maybe, the carriers table in OnDemand is going to need to have a tv_view_id column added to it so it can pass that along with any request to update a claim in TV.

I'm dropping these instructions I received from Falin in here for our discussion about this:

Billing
Each file will be billed at $300 per file for the pilot and then $385 after the pilot.Â It may make sense to have drop down and do a calculated field that will reduce if that drop down says (pilot).Â  Â We will be automatically generating the billing invoices from the On Demand System -> XA but need to track for A/R

Fees
For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -Â  their name/email should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application (it will be attached to the specific claim number)

For the Desk Adjuster - their information will push over as the XACTNET address.Â  So Maxwell or whoever will need to continue to add adjusters to that linked XACTNET Adjusters app

Calculated Fee to be paid to Field Inspector / Drone Resources:
1 Story Inspection: $95.00
2 Stories or More: $20.00 add on
Pitch > 7/12: $40 add on

For Example:Â  2 Story 9/12 Roof would be $155.

Flat Fee to be paid to the Desk Adjuster:

$95.00 per file

Test/live API endpoints are the same as for attachments, notes, reassignment etc and using the same API key:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/tv/{viewId}

The body of the POST is JSON in the form:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 3,
      "pitch": "7/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Josh Harden",
      "type": "Drone Pilot",
      "payrollID": "XYZ987"
    }
  }
}

The "data" object should contain at least one value but doesn't need to contain all of the possible values, e.g. these are also valid:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 5
    }
  }
}

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "pitch": "2/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Patsy Hangdog",
      "payrollID": "ABC001"
    }
  }
}

Valid viewId values are currently:

  • SFI (carrier_id 3985225): 1339
  • Demo (carrier_id 2642910): 1563

The call is processed and forwarded over to TrackVia immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body of the form: {"error": "invalid TV view ID"}.
